table.name: civicrm_mail_settings
table.comment: Various email accounts for use by CiviMail (and its processor)

field.name: domain_id
field.title: Mail Settings Domain
field.comment: Which Domain is this match entry for

field.name: name
field.title: Mail Settings Name
field.comment: name of this group of settings

field.name: is_default
field.title: Is Default Mail Settings?
field.comment: whether this is the default set of settings for this domain

field.name: localpart
field.title: email Local Part
field.comment: optional local part (like civimail+ for addresses like civimail+s.1.2@example.com)

field.name: protocol
field.title: Protocol
field.comment: name of the protocol to use for polling (like IMAP, POP3 or Maildir)

field.name: is_ssl
field.title: Mail Account Uses SSL
field.comment: whether to use SSL or not

field.name: source
field.title: Mail Folder
field.comment: folder to poll from when using IMAP, path to poll from when using Maildir, etc.

field.name: activity_status
field.title: Activity Status
field.comment: Name of status to use when creating email to activity.

field.name: is_non_case_email_skipped
field.title: Skip emails which do not have a Case ID or Case hash
field.comment: Enabling this option will have CiviCRM skip any emails that do not have the Case ID or Case Hash so that the system will only process emails that can be placed on case records. Any emails that are not processed will be moved to the ignored folder.

field.name: is_contact_creation_disabled_if_no_match
field.title: Do not create new contacts when filing emails
field.description: If this option is enabled, CiviCRM will not create new contacts when filing emails.
